Reviews.Title: “Great location, not the best place EVER..it's doable.”
Reviews.Author: denvertraveler06
Reviews.Content: I’ll be quick. Great location, great price. Downtown-walking distance. Off an awesome little street with a ton of affordable food. Free parking. But you get what you pay for. Really simple. Semi –clean. Acceptable, I’d say. See my review of a hotel in Paris for worse. Really friendly people. Dated towels, kitchen dishes not cleaned well at all. But again, remember what you pay for it.

Reviews.Title: “great location, reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: ljb2Canada
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we've stayed at the Ocanside. The location is fabulous - you can walk everywhere. Parking is included which is rare inVancouver. It's so convenient to have a kitchen and a separate bedroom as well as wifi. Excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Not fancy but worth the price”
Reviews.Author: Trione1
Reviews.Content: This was my first time at the Oceanside Hotel and I wasn't too sure what it was going to be like because the price was so low. When I got there, Sam the gentleman behind the counter was very friendly and helpful. He even showed me my parking spot. The furniture and carpets are a bit dated, but clean and in decent condition. The suite was very large and well laid out. The bed was very comfortable. There was very little noise all night and just about no traffic noise in the morning. The hotel is located about 1/2 a block from all kinds and types of eating establishments and 1/2 a block from English Bay and the waterfront. It is also a short distance from the Park. I couldn't have planned for a better or more enjoyable location. There are no fancy shampoos or frills in the bathroom, but the whole suite cost far less than single bedroom in another hotel. And the parking is FREE! This is worth at least $20 a day in any other hotel/motel. Just about the only down side I could say is that the heating is steam and there is no control for it. The room was a bit warm in the evening and night so I just left a couple of windows open a bit. There is no air conditioning, but Vancouver cools off in the evening in the summer so same thing, leave the windows open a bit. I wouldn't have a problem recommending this hotel and plan to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION-EVERYTHING WITHIN WALKING DISTANCE”
Reviews.Author: terry b
Reviews.Content: This place was a great find. The suites were newly renovated and huge. We found the hotel to be very clean and comfortable with big screen TV , free wireless internet, free parking and very friendly staff. It is just a block away from the English Bay beach and within easy walking distance to the city centre and Stanley Park. It is surrounded by dozens of restaurants. Great Location We would deffinately go back and would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: BrunaCueto
Reviews.Content: It's rather an apartment than a hotel room, which was great, since I could drop by the nearest market and fix a meal, instead of splashing around in expensive restaurants all the time. The room was huge, divided into a big bedroom with drawers and closets, a bathroom, a small american style kitchen and a huge living room complete with a sofa bed, coffee table, armchairs, an LCD TV and a table with a set of 4 chairs. It was really more than I expected, since I was only sharing the room with my sister. The building is pretty close to Stanley Park and some 5 blocks from Robson Street - but that was ok cause we could always walk or take a bus and be there in no time. The staff is great and helpful, specially Elena, who became a dear friend of us. I highly recommend and will surely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Overall good rating but do be aware on a couple of points ........”
Reviews.Author: GulliverTales
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel between 6th to 15th September 2011 - we were in Vancouver for a leisure holiday. I give this hotel an overall positive rating. First let me list the positive aspects: good location - right by English Bay, shops & plenty of sit-down restaurants & take-away places. Close to Safeways & discount supermarket as well as other shops including an office licence AKA liquor store if you wish to purchase alcohol (there is a mini-mall nearby). Entertainment also nearby including a local cinema. Close to transport links (buses to metro stations/Ferry/tourist trolley stop). Within easy distance of Stanley Park. Apartments were spacious & generally clean. You can choose when the maid comes in to clean. Staff were generally friendly & knowledgeable about the local area. The great thing about this hotel was that it was the cheapest rate in Vancouver, free wi-fi access & allowed smokers & pets. Also had a sofa bed for additional guests if needed. OK, so this was the basic end of the accommodation market, but I still think it's good value although don't expect the Hilton. As I list a few of the negative aspects this point may become more apparent to you. So, onto the negative points: the cutlery & tea towels had seen better days - they were old and very much used, evidenced by a burnt in stain found within a saucepan. The frying pan was the smallest I'd ever seen, which made cooking breakfast difficult. The towels in the bathroom were small & rough. The bath had mould in places and really did deserve a good scrub! The water was difficult at times when showering; it would turn boiling hot, even when no-one else in the same apartment had switched a tap on. These apartments have NO LIFT so not good if you are disabled etc. There is NO air-conditioning whatsoever - I can imagine it being very hot/stuffy in summer. There is NO noise insulation - we were not disturbed too much during our stay (perhaps because the building was quiet due to it being off season), but we could hear the people above us quite clearly. As I mentioned, the staff were generally friendly & helpful, but our first impression upon check-in was frankly appalling. We had booked a smoking room at $100 per night. When we checked-in the lady at reception was extremely rude to us saying that the hotel did not supply smoking rooms (outright lie). She then argued the nightly price saying that price was actually $120 nightly. In essence, my email confirming a smoking apartment @ a nightly rate of $100 was not enough to stop her arguing, but when I suggested she called the manager who made our reservation, she did so (give her credit there I guess!) and the manager confirmed that the email I produced & booking conditions I was stating was indeed correct. However, this lady continued to be rude saying things like 'I have to keep all the customers happy not just you!', to which our replay was 'that is why we checked prior to booking your hotel'! Other smokers did check into the hotel after us & there were regular smokers staying there. Learn from this lesson - reserve via email if you are booking a smoking room AND/OR if you wish to secure a certain nightly rate. Rates have started to go up on their internet site, so do be careful that you pay the price that you reserved at. But considering all the above points I would recommend this hotel. It's cheap & central & close to transport links. But do bear in mind the saying 'you get what you pay for'.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and free parking”
Reviews.Author: UnderwaterDiva
Reviews.Content: Three of us recently stayed at the Oceanside Hotel Vancouver before taking the ferry to Vancouver Island. It's an easy walk to Stanley Park and the Aquarium, and is only a couple blocks from the water. There are lots of reasonably priced restaurants nearby, of all types. Parking was in a gated, covered garage, and was included in the price. The one day we toured the area, we just walked. Our suite was on the second floor, and there are no elevators. There was a large bedroom with a radiator type heater. Our friend stayed in the living room with the pull-out couch and we all shared the one bathroom. There was also a dining room and a fully equipped kitchen which we did not use. There was also a radiator in the living room. It took a while to figure out how to use it--just reach inside the bottom to turn the hidden knob--easy! We had a corner suite, and could see a bit of the water. Felt very safe in the neighborhood and it was surprisingly quiet at night. Some people stay here for weeks or months. The suite was somewhat dated, but very clean. The towels are a bit thin, but were adequate. We were more than happy with our stay and would certainly stay at the Oceanside again.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent location to explore a fantastic city”
Reviews.Author: Alistair C
Reviews.Content: The hotel is about 10 blocks from the main downtown area, but that should not put anyone off from staying here. Vancouver isn't the cheapest place for us Brits right now, but the bars and restaurants near the Oceanside represent the best value that we found; e.g. near half-price beer when compared with downtown. The hotel is right next to Stanley Park and English Beach, with a fantastic and pretty cheap bus service all the way downtown if you want to go shopping or visit the other attractions. The hotel's room are quite small, but were perfect for our 1-week stay. I definitley like the separate bedroom and sitting area. the staff were very helpful, especially when my bag disappeared with the room key in it!! Highly recommended!!

Reviews.Title: “It's all about location”
Reviews.Author: snes
Reviews.Content: Once you realize that you are staying at the middle of Vancouver’s West End with easy walking access to Stanley Park, beaches, wonderful restaurants and many other amenities available in one of the most beautiful cities in the world, you would stop noticing the fact that this hotel is just an old apartment building with no elevator turned into hotel. You wouldn’t care that faucets are leaking, kitchen appliances are old, and bathrooms are almost falling apart. The hotel staff was friendly and accommodating, of course within their abilities. Cleaning was far from spectacular. In general it’s OK place to stay if you are not planning to spend much time in the room, and do not get too annoyed when you see somebody’s hair in the bathroom after it was supposedly cleaned. I would recommend this hotel to my friends, but with the following warning: “Do not expect it to be luxurious or even clean. It is what it is. Just enjoy your time in beautiful Vancouver”

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: 1799susie
Reviews.Content: I gave this hotel a 5 star because it was in such a great location to Stanley park with prices 1/3 less than others in the area. Our room was almost identical to our room at the Sylvia next door but was 75.00 less. This is a great place if you are on a budget.This hotel does not have any frills but the rooms and baths are large and ours was clean. The Sylvia next door has a lot of energy so we went over there to have a drink on their patio and dinner. This is the best of both worlds. Please remember that this is a five star rTing for folks who want a nice clean hotel and good price but it is not a luxury place.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Suebron
Reviews.Content: Our party of 4 stayed at Oceanside twice during our stay in Canada. Both times we found the hotel to be clean and tidy. Amentities were great and the location was fantastic. So close to the beach and Stanley Park. The staff were always friendly and extremely helpful. Would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable and clean”
Reviews.Author: aoesis
Reviews.Content: the rooms have been renovated and are clean and comfortable. the only 2 complaints i have: is that they did not upgrade their pots and pans. when i went to use one i found it to be old and uncleanable with residue that i just could not scrub off. the manager was nice enough to check their storage room for another, but none was available. there was a bit of mold in the caulking of the tub. the staff are always pleasant. overall, it is a nice stay for us.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly the place we needed”
Reviews.Author: PacificNWFamily
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a great three-night stay in Vancouver over the US Thanksgiving holiday weekend. Our group of five stayed in the 2 bedroom “penthouse” on the 3rd floor. It cost a bit more than renting two one bedroom suites, but it was the perfect accommodation for us. While not luxurious, it’s perfectly adequate and a great home-base for a visit to Vancouver. Sleeping: one room has a queen size bed. The foot of the bed is about six inches from the wall. The other bedroom has two single beds. The living room sofabed seemed to be fine for our 5th adult. Overall, mattresses are comfortable, pillows are fine, and bedding fairly new. Bathroom: There are some cosmetic upgrades needed including replacing the cracked bathroom window, but overall the bathroom vents well, has plenty of storage, and works fine. The towels are fairly small & skimpy, but usable. Views: This penthouse apartment has windows on most walls so you can see English Bay, Denman Street, or neighboring condos. Heat: The in-room heaters have a dial at the bottom left. This heating system is unusual enough that I think they should tell guests about it when they check in. Parking: We were allotted one outside parking place next door and one spot in the underground garage. It’s small and fairly challenging to maneuver into the spaces, but do-able. Staff: Maid service was great. Front desk staff asked if they could help us carry our luggage up to the 3rd floor, but we declined. We asked for directions to a nearby grocery store, and received great information about shopping at the Denman Place Mall. The staff did everything we wanted and were available for more. Overall this is definitely someplace we’d stay again. The location can’t be beat!

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel experience!”
Reviews.Author: Katefromthecreek
Reviews.Content: The Oceanside has been completely renovated, including new comfortable beds and sofabed in the living room of the one-bedroom apartments. So older reviews complaining about old, worn or dirty conditions are out of date. A friendly welcome from Sam as we arrived (even to the point of addressing me by name before I was through the front door!). Yes, there's no elevator, so if this is a problem, stay elsewhere. But taking our bags up two flights of stairs is a small matter in a hotel of such value and location. We were given a corner suite with everything we needed in a one-bedroom apartment, including FREE wi-fi and local phone calls, something you rarely get in much higher-priced hotels. Apparently there is also free parking, another bonus. The suite was spacious, well-equipped and clean. The kitchen had a full-sized fridge and stove, as well as all dishes, cutlery, cups, glasses, etc., that we could possibly need. We could have cooked and served a full-course dinner if we'd chosen to. Microwave, Toaster, Kettle, Coffeemaker and what appeared to be a new granite countertop. Of course the location is superb! English Bay a few steps away and Stanley Park nearby, and all the shops and restaurants of the West End. Bring your own toiletries; towels and soap provided. If you need tiny bottles of shampoo and conditioner supplied, stay somewhere much more expensive. This suite was only $80 a night for two people! $20 more for an extra guest for one night. A fantastic deal!

Reviews.Title: “excellent location, spacious room, and dog friendly!”
Reviews.Author: yescanada
Reviews.Content: It can be hard to find decent accomodations when travelling with a dog, but Oceanside was a great find. Just 1 block from the beach, 3 blocks from Stanley Park, and many restaurant choices on Denman 1 block away. I had the equivalent of a 1-bedroom apt so lots of room and a kitchen w/ microwave. Desk staff were very friendly and helpful. As someone else said, it's not the Ritz, yet it's better than budget. It's an older hotel, but very clean and has new furniture. No elevator; only 3 stories tho. The doors may be hollow since there was some hallway noise, but it's a small complex so not much foot traffic. I will DEFINITELY stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “A basic apartment, clean, spacious and great location.”
Reviews.Author: Hankx5
Reviews.Content: Great value for the basic needs after spending two weeks travelling and hotel stays. A bit short on kitchen facilities but all the basics there for own preps of breakfast and dinner. A quiet tree lined street - although high rise buildings are in close proximity. Reception staff very helpful and friendly - with local advise on transport etc. Close proximity to the cosmopolitan Denman & Davie Streets with many food supermkts / shops / restaurants & cafes. also only 5 mins walk to Stanley Park; 2 minutes to English Bay. Downtown only 10 mins. via Metro transport trolley bus from stops in Denman Street. 1/2 hour walk along English Bay and via ferry to Granville Island .

Reviews.Title: “Great location, cute little suite... but not without problems”
Reviews.Author: SunSeekerVictoriaBC
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel during the Olympic games and paid a very high price for what it was...but then again all hotels were priced obscenely during the games. It is a nicely renovated older apartment block. Don't be fooled by the old cheesy sign, it is moderately renovated for the most part. No elevator. It could be a very charming place to stay long term as it is a block from the beach and a short bus ride to Robson and shopping and business districts. Cute little apartment with a comfy bed (although the double bed filled the bedroom end to end), kitchenette and 42 inch TV! GREAT! However, there are very obvious maintenance problems that are not properly addressed by a competent maintenance worker nor is the housekeeping at all up to par. When I opened the door to my room the molding fell off in front of me with the security chain attached; then when I brought this to the attention of the front desk (with the maintenance guy standing there at the hotel entrance) the maintenance guy became irritated and said that the security chain on the molding is "just for decoration - it would not work anyway." Wow great! feel so safe considering the flimsy deadbolt left on the door <insert sarcasm> So OK, I had worked in a crappy hotel for most of my youth so I knew it was not worth making a big deal over...especially during the Olympics when I was looking forward to celebrating out on the town. So I put the molding to the side and got settled in. I went to hang my clothes in the closet and the mirrored door was dirty and half hanging off - and in the closet was a large framed picture with the glass smashed in and an array of misc hangers from a previous guest. Again I brought this to the attention of the front desk, the clerk (owner/manager?) was very apologetic and explained that they have had a lot of problems during the Olympics. This mistake on the part of housekeeping didn't bother me so much as I was more concerned about the $100 damage deposit that was credited to my visa before checked in. None of the problems I reported were ever dealt with nor was I was ever offered any sort of compensation for the state of the room. The crappy hotel I used to work for offered a 15% off a future stay to guests who had any reasonable complaints - and most of the time they never used the discount...but it was the gesture that mattered. Anyway, It really wasn't at all a negative experience - I had a lovely time in Vancouver and liked the little suite. The desk guy/manager is a very nice guy (if only nice could fix problems). I would go back again if the price was right....would be a great place to stay if you wanted to see the festival of light fireworks. BUT...if you are particular about the hotels you choose being 100% problem free and are picky about cleanliness I would suggest staying elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Travellers-------BEWARE!!!”
Reviews.Author: gramsie8
Reviews.Content: The Sylvia Hotel (the one I normally stay at when I come into town) was fully booked for last weekend and referred me to Oceanside Hotel on Pendrell. I came into town a couple of weeks prior to look into it and make a reservation. I was 'guaranteed' Room 4 which had two beds (which I needed).....I was bringing in my granddaughter for us to be close to the Weekend Walk to End Breast Cancer, which both my daughters were in, and also for my granddaughter to spend some time down at the sea wall and explore the safe part of the West End. I had received in writing a confirmation of that reservation as well. Upon driving into Vancouver on Friday and arriving at that 'hotel', I was informed 'there was something wrong with that room' and they didn't have any other rooms for me.....(except for one small room with one bed only). I inquired as to what was wrong with the room..thinking perhaps water damage or something similar, they evaded the question several times. I finally got it out of them that they had rented it to someone else!!! Supposedly someone had been in it and decided they wanted to stay longer!!!! Mind you, they waited on a man that came in after me and registered him first even though I was there waiting to be waited on and gave him a room!!!! They said the best they could do was refer me to the Bosmans Hotel in Vancouver......I've since learned that they are connected somehow. But at this stage, I had no other choice but to take it. Check out Trip Advisor about them…I’m lucky I guess I survived the stay without any theft, break-in etc.!!!

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: wishing123
Reviews.Content: We checked into the hotel on 12/5/09@ 11pm.The 2 bed rooms apt we had was on the 4th level of the building. Imagine our horrors when told we needed to lug all our luggages to the room ourselves and there was NO elevator! We were from Singapore visiting Vancover for 20days with 7 days on the Alaskan cruise and 4 days on the Rockies.My husband and i, both in our late sixties together wither my sister and cousin find this arrangement ridiculus, having to climb up and down the flight of stairs several times daily and having to lug our luggages up and down the 4 levels of stairways with NO offer of help from the staff. Other than Mr Sam, the rest of the staff were rather unfriendly and aloof. Cleaniliness wise it was acceptable, pricewise it was costilier than the other apartments with elevators available in some others along Robson street.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, just a few things need fixing”
Reviews.Author: Love_2_Travel_djkljd
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel, so I'll get the complaints out of the way first. They use an old fashioned key system, which doesn't seem very secure. A guest could stay for one night, go get a copy of the key made, then return days after they checked out and rob the current occupant of the room (or worse). Also the door knob to your room's door is the kind found on bathrooms or bedrooms, not front doors. On the inside you have to push it in and turn it to lock it. My door (even when locked) could be pushed open from the outside because there was a latching problem. You had to keep shutting it over and over to get it to latch. Also there's no elevator. Hope you don't have luggage if you are staying on the 2nd floor, which is really the 3rd floor to Americans. Have fun climbing all the stairs with it. So those are my only complaints. Now on to the good things. Pros: Former apartments, so you get more than a room, you get a whole apartment. It was bigger and nicer than my own one bedroom apartment. One block from English Bay Beach. I could even see it thru an opening between two buildings. Walking distance to Stanley Park. One block from all the trendy restaurants and shops on Denman street. Free wifi Large flat panel TV. Windows that open. Quiet street, the main sound I heard were seagulls when I had the windows open. Overall a very nice place to stay that I recommend. They just need to fix a few things.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: mambo202
Reviews.Content: Hotel was in great location. Very safe part of vancouver and quieter area. close to shops etc but still in walking distance of stanley park and Robson. We stayed further downtown later and this area was much nicer/less homeless/quieter area. The rooms were nice and big. The couch was hard to pull out at first but eventually figured it out. They were renovating while we where there so a little noisy and messy at times but will be very nice after. Staff friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend”
Reviews.Author: purplxstar
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for our one day/night in Vancouver. The price was pretty good considering the location. On the hotels.com website, it indicated that we would be getting a bedroom area with a queen bed and a living room area with a sofa bed, in addition, also kitchenette with microwave. Upon check-in, we were told that there are some plumbing problem in the bldg, and were offered a room at another hotel further in downtown. We declined, because we've already spend enough time finding the hotel. We were given a studio room on the first level with no kitchenette. The room was just the bare minimum, window opens up half street level, two small (twin?) beds, walls/fixtures looks old with bad fixup jobs. I guess overall the room was clean, but somehow I just didn't feel like it was clean. The gated parking garage was dark, old, and smelly. I think it fits about... <10 cars. The only thing going for this hotel would be the location. It is located off of a pretty busy street (Denman), with shops, restaurants, coffee shops. Also several blocks away from entrance to Stanley Park. About 2 blocks away is the beach at English Bay. We were able to walk along the beach down to the bridge to take the ferry across to the Granville Island. We also felt fairly safe walking back to the hotel late at night.

Reviews.Title: “never again”
Reviews.Author: rlv2104
Reviews.Content: During our visit to Vancouver we stayed in this hotel for 2 nights. Several items were very strange: Room not ready at 5pm when we wanted to check in. Keys to doors are still the old fashioned way, no cards. We were asked if we wanted to have room service, we asked for clean towels and this never happened. Parking was terrible in a small garage, especially if you drive a big Tahoe. Rooms were not clean and could use new paint like the rest of this hotel, and the windows didn't close. The only good thing about this hotel was the location. Next time when we are in Vancouver, we will NOT stay in this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Large rooms, great location”
Reviews.Author: lauralei_7
Reviews.Content: This is not a fancy chain but a small privately owned establishment. Rooms are basic but large. Apparently they will be updating rooms in 2008, which is nice since when we visited, the beds weren't the most luxurious. Great rooms for the price and location. Steps to the beach and Stanley Park, right in the middle of the Davie St area full of restaurants, shops, nightlife, it is a wonderful location. Staff are VERY friendly and helpful. Some rooms even have kitchens! Great for the budget traveler or family who doesn't need a 4 star name to have fun! And best yet, the parking is free, when it can be $30 a day at other hotels in Vancouver. But it's best to see Vancouver by public transportation, as the traffic can be bad. Take your feet, the bus, ferries, train, or Skytrain!

Reviews.Title: “Clean Hotel, excellent staff at The Oceanise in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: kataz
Reviews.Content: I needed an affordable suite in Vancouver and found the Oceanside. The room was not fancy but clean. The front desk staff, couldn't have been more helpful. Great location and great value. The free parking was a bonus. I would have loved to see a few room amenities such as coffee, paper towels, etc.

Reviews.Title: “nice location”
Reviews.Author: mossy10
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights in June 2008. Plenty of room in the apartment, although I wished for a bedside lamp to save getting out of bed. The room had just been decorated, in fact I think they were decorating throughout. The staff were very friendly. The location was excellent. 5 Minutes walk to English Bay and 10 Minutes to Stanley Park. 10 minutes from Robson Street. It was very quiet and didn't have to use our ear plugs once

Reviews.Title: “Nice place with a few flaws”
Reviews.Author: blairb366
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Oceanside Hoted for three nights in late May. The hotel has a good location, one block from the beach, on a quiet side street, in the West End area of downtown Vancouver. The staff was very friendly and helpful at check in and check out. The room was huge, actually a full fledged one bedroom apartment instead of a hotel room, complete with kitchen, fridge, stove, micowave and kitchen plates/utensils. A convenience store was nearby and it was a few blocks to a full grocery store. A few negatives included the noise from the neighbors back porch in the early evening (as we overlooked it), the wall repair that was very noticeable in the hallway and no deadbolt(just a link chain lock) on the door. It was a short walk to the beach, Stanley Park, the eclectic restaurants and shops of the West End and the shopping on Robson Street. The price (about $135/night) was very reasonable for the size of the room and the location.

Reviews.Title: “Worked for us”
Reviews.Author: jenfromseabeck
Reviews.Content: We just returned from two nights in Vancouver with our two young kids. This hotel was great for our family and offered space and a good location. I also experienced my first ever upgrade. I had reserved a one bedroom with a fold out couch in the livingroom; as far as I could tell all rooms were the same. Upon arrival we were upgraded to room 301. It has two bedrooms, one with a queen and one with two singles. All this for $130/night CANADIAN including all taxes. Cons:Dusty hallways due to remodel. Room furniture was dated and shabby. No elevator, and 301 is on the 4th floor by US counting. All rooms have lovely views of parking lots. Kitchen had only the most basic equipment, no paper towels or cookie sheets. Bathroom had soap, but no other toiletries or hair dryer. Pros: $130 night Canadian including all taxes. Hard to beat the price. Sam at the front desk (he gave us the upgrade) and all the other desk people were prompt, friendly and helpful. They actually seemed to care, something I find unusual in even the nicest chain hotels. We had an assigned parking spot so there were no worries about returning at night. The hotel is just off Denman which provided a wealth of great restaurants and a grocery store. We could walk to the beach. The room was clean and the bathroom tile was new. Our two bedroom gave the kids plenty of room to play and they enjoyed watching the Disney channel, something they don't get at home. This hotel isn't luxory, but we liked it.

Reviews.Title: “Grimy”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Bring several cleaning supplies. The room was very musty smelling and the walls needed to be cleaned. It was close to everything exciting so I wouldn't stay anywhere else. Sunset beach is but a block away theres always something new to discover just a few blocks away. Prepare to bring your own hair dryer and shampoo and soap. Extra blankets wouldn't hurt too much either.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our apartment at the Oceanside hotel was clean and spacious. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. But the best thing about the Oceanside hotel is it's location! Denman street with lots of restaurants is around the corner, also English Bay and Stanley Park ... and downtown isn't far either. The hotel really is a great bargain, I guess it's hard to find something comparable in Vancouver for the same rate!

Reviews.Title: “A Bargain in West End!”
Reviews.Author: Forest20851
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Oceanside over the Memorial Day holiday. My first thought was "What have I gotten myself into?". There is no place to park anywhere near the hotel. The small lobby had luggage left there by early arriving guests who had gone elsewhere. And after I checked in, I was informed that there was no air conditioning and no elevator, and I would have to tote my rollerbag up two flights of stairs to my assigned room. Okay, so far so good as I'm in pretty good shape for my age, and my room was being billed at $100 CDN a night. In English Bay, the most expensive neighborhood in Vancouver, you have to give up something in order to get these good rates. And my "room" turned out to be a freshly painted two-room apartment with a full kitchen and bathroom. The kitchen was fully outfitted, and the bathroom had been recently retiled and painted. The living room furniture seemed to be attic finds that were in very good condition. I was reminded of the student apartment I had as an undergraduate back in the 1960s. The buildings even looked similar. The Oceanside's parking garage turned out to be underneath the building and only held eight vehicles. It was entered from an alley behind the hotel where I frequently saw policemen ticketing illegally parked cars. Then the reality set in. I was in a $100 a night hotel in West End Vancouver surrounded by million dollar high-rise condominiums. Denman, Davie, and Robson streets were within easy walking distance. The entertainment district was a few blocks away. Two different trolley-busses stopped the next street over. And both Sunset Beach and Stanley Park were around the corner. So, even if the Oceanside was more European boutique-chic than standard-issue Marriott or Hilton, this place is a fantastic bargain.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel a little frayed at the edges”
Reviews.Author: prophotoguy
Reviews.Content: It is hard to find budget lodging in Vancouver, so perhaps the comparison is a bit unfair. The Oceanside is an older property (1960's) in Vancouver's West End that is not aging gracefully. There is no air conditioning, so comfort in summer and street noise is a bit of an issue. The carpeting is getting threadbare, the towels are paper thin, and you'll need your own shampoo. If you like a rock hard mattress, you'll be fine. The suites are huge, however, with full kitchen.

Reviews.Title: “Great room on English Bay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The suite was good. Plenty of space. All the necessities. There was parking underneath the building which helped since the neighborhood is pretty crowded. We liked it and the price was right.

HotelInfo.Name: Oceanside Hotel Vancouver
HotelInfo.Address: 1847 Pendrell Street, Vancouver, British Columbia V6G 1T3, Canada
